greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(row,col): A(1,1) = 1, A(1,col) = A055938(col-1), and for row > 1: A(row,col) = A005187(1+A(row-1,col)).
comment: The array is read by antidiagonals: A(1,1), A(1,2), A(2,1), A(1,3), A(2,2), A(3,1), etc.
This is transpose of array A255555, see comments and links given there.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10440; the first 144 antidiagonals of array
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: A(row,col): A(1,1) = 1, and for the rest of topmost row: A(1,col) = A055938(col-1), and for any row > 1: A(row,col) = A005187(1+A(row-1,col)).
